photo.description: PARIS.- Stravinsky Square. Stravinsky Fountain (or Fontaine des automates) near the Centre Pompidou, Paris (1982) This Fountain was created by Niki de Saint Phalle and Jean Tinguely. It represents the 'Mae West' lips Sofa ... relates to Dali's paintings and drawings that were inspired by the Hollywood actress, Mae West.
photo.tags: france paris fountain vacancy pompidou lumix lx2 flickrdiamond aplusphoto colourartaward
photo.title: The Kiss

photo.description: Day 139 Getting back to vacation photos - only a few more days to go, and then I'll be caught up! You can see the whole (still incomplete) set of Italy and Paris photos here, if you are so inclined. This was our second day in Paris. We spent most of the day wandering around the Right Bank. The Stravinsky Fountain, pictured here, is quite a lot of fun for toddlers and adults alike. I had a lot of fun photographing it, although like so many things in Paris it is hard to find a new take on it. Other highlights of the day, in addition to the Stravinsky Fountain pictured here, included some amazing hot chocolate and a nice playground. Taken May 18, 2012 in Paris, Île-de-France, France ¹⁄₄₀₀₀ sec at f/1.8, ISO400, no flash. Lens: EF50mm f/1.4 USM @ 50 mm

photo.description: I Love You The Stravinsky Fountain, also called Tinguely-Fountain, is a fountain on Place Igor Stravinski at the Centre Georges Pompidou in Paris, France. It was build by Swiss artist Jean Tinguely together with French artist Niki de Saint Phalle in 1982/83. (Thanks T_Jak for the details)

photo.description: The Stravinsky Fountain (fr: La Fontaine Stravinsky) is a whimsical public fountain ornamented with sixteen works of sculpture, moving and spraying water, representing the works of composer Igor Stravinsky. It was created in 1983 by sculptors Jean Tinguely and Niki de Saint Phalle, and is located on Place Stravinsky, next to the Centre Pompidou, in Paris (20110820-135338-3629_3631-1000d-hdr-a1b2c1)

photo.description: A pond with arty-farty contraptions just next to the Centre Georges Pompidou, called La fontaine Stravinsky or Fontaine des Automates. Unfortunately, the fountain was turned of. That is...God's fountain was turned on (rain) and Stavinsky's was off...maybe they coördinate that.

photo.description: The famous Stravinsky fountain right next to the Centre Pompidou. It has been so cold in France the last couple of days that the bottom of the fountain is actually half-frozen. I guess it would have been more beautiful if it had been completely frozen ! La fameuse fontaine Stravinsky, ou fontaine des automates. Il a fait froid ces derniers jours en France et le fond de la fontaine est à moitié gelé. J'imagine que cela aurait été plus joli si la fontaine était complètement gelée.
photo.tags: ice fountain travel artificiallandscape afsdxnikkor1855mmf3556gediinonvr tourism paris france
